results.title: The Music man
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Morton Da Costa
results.brief_description: A con artist arrives in River City, Iowa with the intention of duping the townspeople into forming a marching band and acquiring band equipment and musical expertise from him - at a price. He does not have a musical bone in his body however, so the band is unlikely to reach fruition. His plan begins to unravel when he falls for Marion (Shirley Jones), a librarian living in River City. This is the rather simplistic plot that provides a backdrop to the many song and dance routines. Robert Preston reprises his Broadway role as con artist “Professor” Harold Hill. Shirley Jones plays the role performed on stage by Barbara Cook. Includes hits such as “Ya got trouble”, “Till there was you”, “Marion the librarian” and “Seventy six trombones”. Cast also includes Buddy Hackett, Hermione Gingold and Paul Ford. The tape also includes a documentary about the making of ‘The Music man’ - “Right here in River City: the making of ‘The Music Man’”, as well as the original theatrical trailer and an introduction by Shirley Jones.

results.title: The Muppets take Manhattan [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, David Lazer and Frank Oz
results.brief_description: Kermit and his Muppet theatrical troupe attempt to stage a musical on Broadway, but are shunted around by unscrupulous producers. In desperation the Muppets each go their own way to make a living but reunite when a young producer discovers their script. Kermit, however, comes down with a case of amnesia and emerges as an agency big shot. Miss Piggy, jealous of Kermit’s friendship with a waitress, karate chops him back to reality and it’s “On with the Show”.

results.title: The Muppet movie
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment, Jim Henson and James Frawley
results.brief_description: Kermit the Frog has finally hit the big time and he’s heading for Hollywood. With his fellow Muppets including Miss Piggy, Gonzo, Animal, Fozzie Bear, plus the rest of the Muppet Performers, they encounter real life stars along the way. Kermit begins his journey on a humble bicycle, but as the passengers accumulate along the way his means of transport increases in size. Kermit also has to contend with the slimy Doc Hopper who is eager for Kermit to promote fried frog legs, as well as his strong feelings for Miss Piggy. Features a number of cameos as well as paying homage to several classic films.

results.title: The Mummy returns
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Alphaville, James Jacks, Sean Daniel and Steven Somers
results.brief_description: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz and Arnold Vosloo return to star in this sequel to the 1999’s blockbuster, ‘The Mummy’. When evil mummy Lord Imhotep is resurrected in a British museum, Rich and Evie O’Connell develop feelings of deja-vu. The situation worsens when their son Alexander discovers the ancient arm bands belonging to the Scorpion King and puts them on, which will awaken the Scorpion King and bring forth the end of the world. When Imhotep discovers the wearer of the bracelets and the only thing standing in his way of reigning again is a child, he arranges for the child to be kidnapped, leaving Evie and Rich only days to save their son and the world from Imhotep and the Scorpion King. Cast also includes wrestling star The Rock, AKA Dwayne Johnson, as the Scorpion King.

results.title: The Mummy
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Carl Laemmle and Karl Freund
results.brief_description: Boris Karloff’s role in the 1932 version of The Mummy has become a landmark in the annals of screen history. Karloff plays Im-Ho-Tep, the mummy, who is accidently revived after 3,700 years by a British archaeology team. In flashback, we find that he was a high priest who was embalmed alive for trying to revive the vestel virgin whom he loved after she had been sacrificed. Now, dressed in the garb of a modern day Egyptian, he sets out to find his lost love, mistaking Helen Grosvenor (Zita Johann) for her and terrorizing the expedition members who must find a way to stop him. Today, almost half a century after its production, this brooding, dream-like film remains a horror masterpiece. Also stars David Manners, Bramwell Fletcher, Arthur Byron and Edward Van Sloan. Based on a story by Nina Wilcox Putnam and Richard Schayer.

results.title: The Mouse that roared
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Carl Foreman and Jack Arnold
results.brief_description: The near-bankrupt Duchy of Grand Fenwick plans to declare war on the USA, be defeated and thus be eligible for Marshall Aid to rebuild its economy. One of those films in which Peter Sellers engagingly plays three parts, effectively carrying the entire film. Based on the novel by Leonard Wibberley.

results.title: The Most dangerous game
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Merian C. Cooper, Ernest B Schoedsack and Irving Pichel
results.brief_description: King Kongs creators made this excellent tale a year before the famous ape burst onto the scene. A vivid retelling of Richard Connells celebrated oft-filmed story about a megalomaniac named Count Zaroff who hunts humans with a bow and arrow on his private island, and charms everyone he encounters. Joel McRae, Fay Wray and Robert Armstrong are his latest prey.

results.title: The Mission (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Puttnam, Fernando Ghia and Roland Joffe
results.brief_description: A man of the sword. A man of the cloth. A clash of civilisations. A fight to the death. A political parable and portrait of 18th century missionary works. Shot on location in the breathtaking jungles of South America. “The Mission” is a movie experience to be shared by all. Stars Robert de Niro and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: The Misfits
results.creator_credit: Seven Arts, United Artists Corporation, Frank E Taylor and John Huston
results.brief_description: In the gambling desert town of Reno, a recently divorced young woman falls for an ageing cowboy. They slowly begin to build a life together but the chance arrival of a younger cowboy, and the older man’s obsession with his romantic memories of the “old West”, threaten to destroy the relationship. A collaboration between New York playwright Arthur Miller and director John Huston, “The Misfits” examines the increasing commercialisation and subsequent alienation of contemporary life by modernising the most traditional of Hollywood genres: the Western. The film stars Marilyn Monroe, Montgomery Clift and Clark Gable in three superb performances. Intense and involving, “The Misfits” also stars Thelma Ritter and Eli Wallach.
